Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 65 Carmine Street, CB 2, Application no. 20125381 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.7347/S.2774, legislation that would legalize the medicinal use of marijuana.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item:  
Council Members Gentile, Ignizio, and Vallone, Jr.

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item:  
Council Members Cabrera.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Legalize the medicinal use of marijuana. (A.7347/S.2774)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to pass and for the President to sign into law S. 1773/ H.R. 3286, the Local Farms, Food and Jobs Act of 2011.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: The Local Farms, Food and Jobs Act of 2011. (S. 1773/ H.R. 3286)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass A.8846, the New York State Senate to pass companion bill S.6077, and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, which would require the New York State Department of Corrections and Community Supervision to place incarcerated adults in correctional facilities located in proximity to the primary place of residence of such individuals’ minor children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Place incarcerated adults in correctional facilities located in proximity to the primary place of residence of such individuals’ minor children. (S.6077 and 8846)

Items.Title: A Local Law to require a plan for the phase-out of the use of typewriters in city government.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Require a plan for the phase-out of the use of typewriters in city government.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation establishing the New York DREAM fund commission, which will advance the educational opportunities of children of immigrants through scholarship programs for higher education.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Establishing the New York DREAM fund commission.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to reject the Birthright Citizenship Act of 2011, which would end the recognition of automatic birthright citizenship for certain classes of people who are born in this country to non-citizen parents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Congress to reject the Birthright Citizenship Act of 2011

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York City’s Board of Elections to promptly and fully comply with both the spirit and letter of the New York State Election Law by promoting the enfranchisement of New York City voters through the provision of Russian translations of voting materials.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Promoting the enfranchisement of NYC voters through the provision of Russian translations of voting materials.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for civil discourse in presidential campaigns and debates, and condemning a candidate's statements claiming that children in poor neighborhoods lack work habits and have no one around them that work and referring to child labor laws as stupid.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Civil discourse in presidential campaigns and debates, and condemning a candidate's statements claiming that children in poor neighborhoods lack work habits and have no one around them that work and referring to child labor laws as stupid.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.6369, which would amend the Penal Law by increasing the penalties for certain offenses committed against an elderly person who is 60 or older, and calling on the Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill, and on the Governor to sign such legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for certain offenses committed against an elderly person who is 60 or older. (A.6369)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to parking violations issued for the failure to display a muni-meter receipt.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Parking violations issued for the failure to display a muni-meter receipt.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring secondhand automobile dealers to furnish bonds to the city.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring secondhand automobile dealers to furnish bonds to the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring secondhand automobile dealers to keep electronic records of purchases and sales.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring secondhand automobile dealers to keep electronic records of purchases and sales.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting vending on the sidewalk abutting no standing zones adjacent to hospitals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting vending on the sidewalk abutting no standing zones adjacent to hospitals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to extending the rent stabilization laws.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Extending the rent stabilization laws.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the collection of waste and recyclables from not-for-profit corporations by the department of sanitation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Collection of waste and recyclables from not-for-profit corporations by the department of sanitation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Water Board to set water and sewer rates to cover only the capital and operating expenses related to operating, maintaining, protecting, and improving the City’s drinking water and wastewater systems, and not to set these fees to pay money into the general fund of the city or for other functions undertaken by the Department of Environmental Protection not related to water and wastewater management.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: NYC Water Board to set water and sewer rates.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives to restore the Mass Transit Account that would be eliminated by the American Energy and Infrastructure Jobs Act of 2012 (H.R. 7), and calling upon the United States House of Representatives to support Congressman Jerrold Nadler’s bipartisan amendment to restore transit funding to H.R. 7, and calling on the United States Senate to not adopt H.R. 7 without such restoration.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: American Energy and Infrastructure Jobs Act of 2012 (H.R. 7)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Consumer Affairs to establish a uniform rating system for retail food stores.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Department of Consumer Affairs to establish a uniform rating system for retail food stores.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale and use of gas-powered leaf blowers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Sale and use of gas-powered leaf blowers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Village Voice Media to stop accepting adult services advertisements on its online classified site, Backpage.com, because it serves as a platform to traffic minors and adult victims for sex.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Village Voice Media to stop accepting adult services advertisements on its online classified site, Backpage.com

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to doubling the civil penalty for illegally operating a motorized scooter.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Doubling the civil penalty for illegally operating a motorized scooter.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transit Authority to investigate how the New York City Police Department is enforcing section 1050.7(j) of the MTA Rules of Conduct, regarding disorderly conduct in the subway.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to investigate how the NYPD is enforcing section 1050.7(j) of the MTA Rules of Conduct, regarding disorderly conduct in the subway.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to phase out and eliminate the use of polystyrene food trays within two years through the use of biodegradable food trays or biodegradable food containers instead.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dep't of Education to phase out and eliminate the use of polystyrene food trays within two years through the use of biodegradable food trays or biodegradable food containers instead.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing September as Suicide Awareness Month in New York City and calling upon government agencies and non-governmental organizations to focus on teen suicide prevention.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Recognizing September as Suicide Awareness Month in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2012.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of NY continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2012.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign into law, the “Restore the American Dream for the 99% Act” to support job creation, increase revenue and savings and protect critical services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Restore the American Dream for the 99% Act

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign the Internet System for Tracking Over-Prescribing Act (A.8320/S.5720A), legislation that would create an online database to report and track the prescription and dispensing of certain controlled substances.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Internet System for Tracking Over-Prescribing Act (A.8320/S.5720A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tax liens.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a sign at inaccessible building entrances, public toilets, and elevators giving directions to the nearest available accessible entrance or facility for persons with disabilities when such  entrance or facility exists.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring a sign at inaccessible building entrances, public toilets, and elevators giving directions to the nearest available accessible entrance or facility for persons with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Labor to eliminate all banking fees on Direct Payment Cards used for unemployment insurance benefit payments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: NYS Dept of Labor to eliminate all banking fees on Direct Payment Cards used for unemployment insurance benefit payments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to introduce and enact, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would amend the New York State Penal Law to define advancing or profiting from prostitution of an individual less than the age of sixteen as sex trafficking.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Define advancing or profiting from prostitution of an individual less than the age of sixteen as sex trafficking.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York and the New York City Charter, in relation to the disciplinary decisions made by the Commissioner of the New York City Police Department.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Disciplinary decisions made by the Commissioner of the NYPD.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting bias-based profiling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting bias-based profiling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring law enforcement officers to provide notice and obtain proof of consent to search individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring law enforcement officers to provide notice and obtain proof of consent to search individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Senate to pass and the Governor to sign S.3921, which would amend the New York State Executive Law in relation to the duties of state police when an offense is committed by a police officer resulting in serious physical injury to another person.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Duties of state police when an offense is committed by a police officer resulting in serious physical injury to another person. (S.3921)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass A.4382, the New York State Senate to introduce and pass similar legislation, and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, granting the New York State Attorney General jurisdiction to investigate and prosecute police misconduct upon the request of the Governor or the District Attorney of the county wherein such misconduct was committed.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Investigate and prosecute police misconduct upon the request of the Governor or the District Attorney of the county wherein such misconduct was committed. (A.4382)

Parks

A Local Law in relation to the naming of 32 thoroughfares and public places, Dra. Evelina Antonetty Way, Borough of the Bronx, Lenny Kobren Circle, Borough of Brooklyn, Ozzie Brown Triangle, Borough of the Bronx, Dr. Michael Lancelot Marcano Way, Borough of the Bronx, Detective Kevin Czartoryski Place, Borough of Queens, Cheyenne Baez Way, Borough of Manhattan, Rev. John B. Elliott Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Jim Buckley Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Meg Charlop Way, Borough of the Bronx, The Chords-Hit Record “Sh-Boom” 1954, Borough of the Bronx, Frank Griffin Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Joe ‘The Great’ Rollino Corner, Borough of Brooklyn, Raoul Wallenberg Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Lt. Peter J. Farrenkopf Place, Borough of Queens, Reginald Nero’s Way, Borough of Brooklyn, First United Methodist Church Way, Borough of Queens, Police Officer Eric Hernandez Memorial Corner, Borough of the Bronx, Thomas X. Winberry Way, Borough of Queens, Julian Brennan Way, Borough of Brooklyn, John Davenport Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Alain Schaberger Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Sgt. Nicholas Aleman Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Miriam Friedlander Way, Borough of Manhattan, Officer Glen Pettit Corner, Borough of Manhattan, Jonathan M. Acierno Way, Borough of Staten Island, Manolo Tavarez Justo Way, Borough of Manhattan, Joseph Mandarino Way, Borough of Staten Island, Det. Raymond “Pally” Taylor Way, Borough of Staten Island, Peggy Braverman Way, Borough of the Bronx, Bishop Moses Taylor Way, Borough of Queens, Charles C. Pinn Triangle, Borough of Brooklyn, Shirley N. Moore Street, Borough of Queens and the repeal of sections 27 and 52 of local law number 47 for the year 2011 and section 22 of local law number 3 for the year 2011.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Homeland Security to create a Haitian Family Reunification Parole Program, which would benefit Haitians recovering from the January 12, 2010 earthquake by allowing Haitians with approved family-sponsored immigrant visa petitions to come to the United States.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: 
Council Members Gentile, Halloran, Oddo, and Vallone, Jr.

.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the Department of Homeland Security to create a Haitian Family Reunification Parole Program.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the Corporation Counsel’s decision to join an amicus brief on behalf of New York City in support of Plaintiff-Appellee in the litigation captioned The United States of America v. The State of Arizona, Case No. CV 10-1413-PHX (SRB), which is currently pending before the United States Supreme Court.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item:  
Council Members Halloran, Ignizio, Oddo, and Vallone, Jr.

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item:  
Council Members Gentile and Ulrich.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the Corporation Counsel’s decision to join an amicus brief on behalf of New York City in support of Plaintiff-Appellee in the litigation captioned The United States of America v. The State of Arizona, Case No. CV 10-1413-PHX (SRB)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, March 14, 2012.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



Int No. 761-A, 47-0-1.

See file for individual vote.

This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, and pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law for a partial tax exemption.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application no. 20125008 TCK, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Le Anfore LLC d.b.a Broken English, to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 68 Bergen Street, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no.33.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.MinutesNote: Filed pursuant to a Letter of Withdrawal.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Filed, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
